reviews.text: The quality of this hotel is excellent, the room was very good ,the food was very tasty and the staff provided a very efficient service. Would certainly recommend this pub/hotel .Oh and I must mention the beer definitely a CAMRA level location .
reviews.title: Very welcoming experience

reviews.text: Once again on a visit to Dundee to see our son we needed some lunch so popped in to The Fishermans Tavern in Broughty Ferry. Service was very friendly as always and the food we ordered was amazing! I had my usual fish and chips! but it is not just fish and chips here it is some thing special, the fish is huge! (as I like it) and the batter so fresh and well its perfection so it is, My wife and son chose items from the enormous list of daily specials and both commented on how good they were and freshly cooked and full of flavour. The amazing bit is the prices unlike some Hotels on the ferry this Hotel keeps its food prices at realistic levels and for me this Tavern is a must for anyone looking for great food in Broughty Ferry.
reviews.title: First class food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great night's stay in the Fisherman's Tavern; really couldn't fault it. The bar was heaving when we arrived at about 5pm, but we were immediately made feel welcome by the team of staff on duty and shown to our room in no time with a table booked for our evening meal for later in the evening.
reviews.title: A wee gem

reviews.text: The room was spacious and pleasantly decorated with a huge zip and link bed with very comfy mattresses. Good sized bathroom too. We were very, very impressed with the standard of accommodation for such a reasonable price. Why stay in a featureless chain hotel when you could have the charm of the Fisherman's Tavern for a fraction of the price?
reviews.title: Great little find

reviews.text: The real ales delighted my partner and our evening meal was delicious,.Had to try the Arbroath smokie pie after reading the reviews and it didn't disappoint. Great breakfast too. We heard others at breakfast mention that they had brought earplugs; I guess that might be a good idea if you fancy an early night, as yes, you can hear the bar below. We didn't mind at all though and had a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: Perfect golfing base

reviews.text: We had an excellent lunch of steak pie and smokie pie today. There was a wide choice in the menu and a blackboard with specials. Very helpful polite and helpful service. A table was reserved for us but it was quiet there today Lovely little pub. Very busy in the evenings and good choice of beers.
reviews.title: Pub lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Fish" as it is known locally is an un-assuming pub, restaurant and hotel in the picturesque seaside village of Broughty Ferry an upmarket suburb of Dundee.
reviews.title: A friendly simple place in a pictureseque situation

reviews.text: It occupies a small but sprawling site on the corner of Fort Street and the waterfront, close by the lifeboat station.
reviews.title: A jewel in the East and the Fisherman`s is an absloute gem

reviews.text: Having just returned from my first ever visit trip to Broughty Ferry (at the seaside and an upmarket extension of Dundee) I am blown awa not only, by this fabulous and very classy town, but also by the Fishermans Tavern. My huge twin room for single occupancy had everything I needed, including a full sized, proper hairdryer, heaps of lovely towels and a fabulous shower. I
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.text: The bar was heaving with locals and the atmosphere was busy. Great food and fantsastic service must keep this place busyall throughout the year. The staff are fantastic, knowlegeable about the speciality beers and local food (fish is big in Broughty Ferry and I had their Smokie Pie-made from Arbroath Smokie-delish)! The bar staff a friendly and welcoming too. Also,at breakfast staff were fantastic fun and could not do enough to ensure we had everything and more that we needed to have a fantastic start to our day. We were all so hungover from all our celebrations the previous evening!!!! A walk on the beach after a hearty breakfast did the trick and gave us the energy to browse the incredible array of bijou shops and boutiques. We hadthe best laugh, though, at a fabulous shop called Topsy Turvy. It sells beautiful gifts and the funniest (and some of the rudest cards I have come across in a long time) The lady owner i a delight too and didnt mind my friend and I helplessly laughing at some of the cards, along with several other lovely customers) We must have been in there for 20 mins, just laughing-dont miss any of these places if you find yourself in BRoughty Ferry. I was my first but definitely not my last trip to The Fishermans, Topsy Turvy and BF.
reviews.title: Warm friendly Hotel & Pub

reviews.text: My son and I booked in here for the night. Good selection of real ales. Reasonable menu and fresh breakfast. Very quaint surroundings. Great value for money. Would certainly reccommend the Fisherman`s Tavern
reviews.title: Good Stop Off

reviews.text: My mum and I stayed here for two nights, the room was comfortable and the staff very warm and friendly. The Arbroath smokie pie was mouthwatering ... Breakfast was good but slightly limited choices however what was on offer was good quality and tasty. I'd recommend this place to others and would definitely return :)
reviews.title: Relaxing, friendly welcome and delicious food

reviews.text: Called in here with friends on a sunny afternoon for a few drinks and some food in the beer garden. The staff were very friendly, the food was pub grub as expected, but that's all we were looking for and it was very nice. Will be back!
reviews.title: Great Food, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Stayed here as a group of 8 golfers and no regrets at all.
reviews.title: No wonder its No1 in Dundee

reviews.text: Booking process was efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Ferry good

reviews.text: Stayed here at the weekend and it was first class. The bar was spotlessly clean and a credit to all that work there, we had a bite to eat Saturday lunchtime and it was very tasty. Keep up the good work !!
reviews.title: Weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight on a Saturday and we were generally pleased with the accomodation and the meals served. The room was clean if a little small with not much space to put a suitcase anywhere.
reviews.title: Good B& B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The down side of staying in a pub B& B is the noise the drinkers make as they leave - enough to wake you but not keep you awake. That said we had a great evening meal - fab fish & chips and a very good breakfast. Staff were friendly and very attentive and would agree with other reviewers about not letting the outside appearance put you off.
reviews.title: Just the bar

reviews.text: Visited whilst at the nearby lifeboat station for lunch. The bar has a great selection of home cooked meals on offer at reasonable prices with a daily specials board as well. The bar boasts a changing selection of cask ales which is always an attraction. There is a beer festival held on the late May bank holiday weekend. I'll be heading back for that one.
reviews.title: Great spot..... golf all around you

reviews.text: Myself and 5 friends went to play golf at Carnoustie and surrounding area, So we chose this hotel to make our base. From the outside it looks like many, many other B&B/Pub Hotels but my room was really modern had a really nice feel to it, shower was really powerful and the breakfasts were massive. (3 days in a row, not good for you!!) The pub its self was OK, there are nice restaurants and pubs close by if you want to venture out for an evening, which we did. (The Ship, round the corner has great views from the upstairs restaurant BTW) Overall I would recommend the Fishermans, no problem.
reviews.title: superb
